comment.narrative: 2007 Technical Assessment found 9,900 tonnes of surplus ammunition and limited national capacity for safe destruction
Destruction of 100 tones of surplus/obsolete ammunition from Phase III of SALW demilitarization project.
Due to the lack of funds 47,74 tones of surplus/obsolete ammunition from Phase III of SALW remilitarization project were disposed using international stadards of disposal.
Destruction of 100 tones of surplus/obsolete ammunition from Phase III of SALW demilitarization project.
Phase III5 of ammunition demilitarization completed and Phase III6 started in Q4. 70 tonnes of ammunition demilitarized altogether due to lack of funds

comment.narrative: Limited general strategic and project development capacities within the municipalities (some trainings and mentoring were organized by international organisations). The Electronic database of development projects has just been launched, therefore none of the municipalities have started populating it (Ministry of Economy).

The project will adopt a comprehensive approach to minimizing the carbon footprint of tourism sector with the immediate target to maintain tourist sector related GHG emissions in Montenegro

title.narrative: Towards Carbon Neutral Tourism in Montenegro

description.narrative: The project will adopt a comprehensive approach to minimizing the carbon footprint of tourism sector with the immediate target to maintain tourist sector related GHG emissions in Montenegro
independent political entity

activity-description.narrative: Promoting Montenegro’s transition towards a carbon neutral travel tourism.

description.narrative: 1. The tourism sector related Green House Gas (GHG) emissions not exceeding the level in 2013 (Year: 2020) 2. Amount of reduced CO2 emissions by the investments facilitated by the project (Year 2019) 3. Extent to which financing mechanisms are being accessed to support low-carbon tourism (Year 2019) 4. Annually reported GHG emissions from tourism sector (2016 onward) 5. Number of amended Laws and Strategies introducing provisions on low-carbon tourism 6. Number of low-carbon spatial plans developed 7. Level of awareness on low carbon tourism in Montenegro

comment.narrative: 1. 77 ktCO2 (Year 2013) 2. 0 (2014) 3. Not adequately: There are no finance mechanisms to support low-carbon tourism 4. Not adequately: The system for greenhouse gas (GHG) emission monitoring in tourism sector does not exist. 5. 0: Low carbon tourism related provisions not included in the Laws and Strategies 6. 0: Low-carbon spatial plans not developed 7. Not adequately: Level of awareness on low-carbon tourism in Montenegro low

1. Include low carbon tourism related provisions in Law on Tourism, National Climate Change Strategy 2. Methodology for GHG emissions calculation in tourism sector developed by 2016 3. Financing mechanisms to support low-carbon tourism developed and accessible by 2019 4. Awareness on low carbon tourism largely improved

1. Low carbon tourism related provisions in included in Law on Tourism, National Climate Change Strategy 2. Methodology for GHG emissions calculation in tourism sector developed 3. Inventory for GHG emissions in tourism calculated 4. Study on financing mechanisms to support climate change mitigation actions in tourism sector developed 5. Survey on low carbon tourism in Montenegro conducted

1. Prepare and implement the first Call for Proposals to co-finance pilot projects leading to reduction of CO2 in tourism sector in municipalities Herceg Novi, Tivat, Kotor and Cetinje 2. External validation of developed GHG Methodology for tourism sector 3. Inventory of GHG in tourism sector for 2014 and 2015 4. Eco-certification initiated in 20 hotels/apartmens 5. Web based carbon footprint calculator for tourists and hotels designed and established 6. Web page of the TCNT Project established 7. Pilot Carbon compensation scheme initiated and promoted

MRV protocols developed for 3 investment projects that will be implemented and supported by the end of 2016.
Bus station in Cetinje reconstructed as low carbon tourism welcome centre and the bike rack for electric bikes established in Tivat bus station. The first Call for Proposals has been implemented and so far three pilot projects have been selected for further support in the amount of 150,000 EUR. Low carbon development principles and measures incorporated in the framework Law on Tourism, Spatial Plan for Special Purpose Coastal Area, National Sustainable Development Strategy, The Study on Low Cost Carriers impact on tourism elaborated. The Polycentric Sustainable Urban Mobility Plan developed for four municipalities. • Various promo materials for the project were developed (flyers, pvc stickers, sun bags, climate change supporting postcards, roll-ups, envelopes, folders, donation boxes for tourist ready to donate for sustainable projects in Montenegro, etc.) and distributed on visible and attractive locations throughout Montenegro Many public events in Montenegro were held under the slogans of our project and/or broadcasting our video on the video wall displays (New Year’s Eve celebrations on the coast, sport events, bicycle events, etc.) Online Carbon calculator available at www.calculateco2.me for tourists is developed and integrated in more than 30 tourism websites in Montenegro (hotels, tour operators, visitor centers etc.) Project web page developed and available at www.lowcarbonmne.me

Complete the GHG Inventory for Tourism sector for 2014 and 2015 Implement of the 2nd Call for Proposals Prepare the program for establishment of Eco Fund Eco certification of 10 tourist facilities Intensify partnership with hotel industry, music festivals,

description.narrative: This project aims to enable Montenegro to prepare, produce and disseminate its Third National Communication to the Conference of the Parties of the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change according to Decision 17/CP8 and other guidance provided.
